intro: Corydalis solida f. multifida, commonly known as the multifid leaf corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink or purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in woodland and meadow habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders.
